00023 #define WIDTH 130
00024 /*
00025  * Each column must be at least one character wide, plus three
00026  * characters between the columns (space, [<|>], space).
00027  */
00028 #define WIDTH_MIN 5
00029 
00030 /* A single diff line. */
00031 struct diffline {
00032         SIMPLEQ_ENTRY(diffline) diffentries;
00033         char    *left;
00034         char     div;
00035         char    *right;
00036 };

00064 static struct option longopts[] = {
00065         { "text",                       no_argument,            NULL,   'a' },
00066         { "ignore-blank-lines",         no_argument,            NULL,   'B' },
00067         { "ignore-space-change",        no_argument,            NULL,   'b' },
00068         { "minimal",                    no_argument,            NULL,   'd' },
00069         { "ignore-tab-expansion",       no_argument,            NULL,   'E' },
00070         { "diff-program",               required_argument,      NULL,   'F' },
00071         { "speed-large-files",          no_argument,            NULL,   'H' },
00072         { "ignore-matching-lines",      required_argument,      NULL,   'I' },
00073         { "ignore-case",                no_argument,            NULL,   'i' },

00084 /*
00085  * Create temporary file if source_file is not a regular file.
00086  * Returns temporary file name if one was malloced, NULL if unnecessary.
00087  */
00088 static char *
00089 mktmpcpy(const char *source_file)
00090 {
00091         struct stat sb;
00092         ssize_t rcount;
00093         int ifd, ofd;
00094         u_char buf[BUFSIZ];
00095         char *target_file;
00096 
00097         /* Open input and output. */
00098         ifd = open(source_file, O_RDONLY, 0);
00099         /* File was opened successfully. */
00100         if (ifd != -1) {
00101                 if (fstat(ifd, &sb) == -1)
00102                         err(2, "error getting file status from %s", source_file);
00103 
00104                 /* Regular file. */
00105                 if (S_ISREG(sb.st_mode))
00106                         return (NULL);
00107         } else {
00108                 /* If ``-'' does not exist the user meant stdin. */
00109                 if (errno == ENOENT && strcmp(source_file, "-") == 0)
00110                         ifd = STDIN_FILENO;
00111                 else
00112                         err(2, "error opening %s", source_file);
00113         }
00114 
00115         /* Not a regular file, so copy input into temporary file. */
00116         if (asprintf(&target_file, "%s/sdiff.XXXXXXXXXX", tmpdir) == -1)
00117                 err(2, "asprintf");
00118         if ((ofd = mkstemp(target_file)) == -1) {
00119                 warn("error opening %s", target_file);
00120                 goto FAIL;
00121         }
00122         while ((rcount = read(ifd, buf, sizeof(buf))) != -1 &&
00123             rcount != 0) {
00124                 ssize_t wcount;
00125 
00126                 wcount = write(ofd, buf, (size_t)rcount);
00127                 if (-1 == wcount || rcount != wcount) {
00128                         warn("error writing to %s", target_file);
00129                         goto FAIL;
00130                 }
00131         }
00132         if (rcount == -1) {
00133                 warn("error reading from %s", source_file);
00134                 goto FAIL;
00135         }
00136 
00137         close(ifd);
00138         close(ofd);
00139 
00140         return (target_file);
00141 
00142 FAIL:
00143         unlink(target_file);
00144         exit(2);
00145 }
00146 
00147 int
00148 main(int argc, char **argv)
00149 {
00150         FILE *diffpipe, *file1, *file2;
00151         size_t diffargc = 0, wflag = WIDTH;
00152         int ch, fd[2], status;
00153         pid_t pid;
00154         char **diffargv, *diffprog = "diff", *filename1, *filename2,
00155             *tmp1, *tmp2, *s1, *s2;
00156 
00157         /*
00158          * Process diff flags.
00159          */
00160         /*
00161          * Allocate memory for diff arguments and NULL.
00162          * Each flag has at most one argument, so doubling argc gives an
00163          * upper limit of how many diff args can be passed.  argv[0],
00164          * file1, and file2 won't have arguments so doubling them will
00165          * waste some memory; however we need an extra space for the
00166          * NULL at the end, so it sort of works out.
00167          */
00168         if (!(diffargv = calloc(argc, sizeof(char **) * 2)))
00169                 err(2, "main");
00170 
00171         /* Add first argument, the program name. */
00172         diffargv[diffargc++] = diffprog;
00173 
00174         while ((ch = getopt_long(argc, argv, "aBbdEHI:ilo:stWw:",
00175             longopts, NULL)) != -1) {
00176                 const char *errstr;
00177 
00178                 switch (ch) {
00179                 case 'a':
00180                         diffargv[diffargc++] = "-a";
00181                         break;
00182                 case 'B':
00183                         diffargv[diffargc++] = "-B";
00184                         break;
00185                 case 'b':
00186                         diffargv[diffargc++] = "-b";
00187                         break;
00188                 case 'd':
00189                         diffargv[diffargc++] = "-d";
00190                         break;
00191                 case 'E':
00192                         diffargv[diffargc++] = "-E";
00193                         break;
00194                 case 'F':
00195                         diffargv[0] = diffprog = optarg;
00196                         break;
00197                 case 'H':
00198                         diffargv[diffargc++] = "-H";
00199                         break;
00200                 case 'I':
00201                         Iflag = 1;
00202                         diffargv[diffargc++] = "-I";
00203                         diffargv[diffargc++] = optarg;
00204                         break;
00205                 case 'i':
00206                         diffargv[diffargc++] = "-i";
00207                         break;
00208                 case 'l':
00209                         lflag = 1;
00210                         break;
00211                 case 'o':
00212                         if ((outfile = fopen(optarg, "w")) == NULL)
00213                                 err(2, "could not open: %s", optarg);
00214                         break;
00215                 case 'S':
00216                         diffargv[diffargc++] = "--strip-trailing-cr";
00217                         break;
00218                 case 's':
00219                         sflag = 1;
00220                         break;
00221                 case 't':
00222                         diffargv[diffargc++] = "-t";
00223                         break;
00224                 case 'W':
00225                         diffargv[diffargc++] = "-w";
00226                         break;
00227                 case 'w':
00228                         wflag = strtonum(optarg, WIDTH_MIN,
00229                             INT_MAX, &errstr);
00230                         if (errstr)
00231                                 errx(2, "width is %s: %s", errstr, optarg);
00232                         break;
00233                 default:
00234                         usage();
00235                 }
00236 
00237         }
00238         argc -= optind;
00239         argv += optind;
00240 
00241         if (argc != 2)
00242                 usage();
00243 
00244         if ((tmpdir = getenv("TMPDIR")) == NULL)                       
00245                 tmpdir = _PATH_TMP;
00246 
00247         filename1 = argv[0];
00248         filename2 = argv[1];
00249 
00250         /*
00251          * Create temporary files for diff and sdiff to share if file1
00252          * or file2 are not regular files.  This allows sdiff and diff
00253          * to read the same inputs if one or both inputs are stdin.
00254          *
00255          * If any temporary files were created, their names would be
00256          * saved in tmp1 or tmp2.  tmp1 should never equal tmp2.
00257          */
00258         tmp1 = tmp2 = NULL;
00259         /* file1 and file2 are the same, so copy to same temp file. */
00260         if (strcmp(filename1, filename2) == 0) {
00261                 if ((tmp1 = mktmpcpy(filename1)))
00262                         filename1 = filename2 = tmp1;
00263         /* Copy file1 and file2 into separate temp files. */
00264         } else {
00265                 if ((tmp1 = mktmpcpy(filename1)))
00266                         filename1 = tmp1;
00267                 if ((tmp2 = mktmpcpy(filename2)))
00268                         filename2 = tmp2;
00269         }
00270 
00271         diffargv[diffargc++] = filename1;
00272         diffargv[diffargc++] = filename2;
00273         /* Add NULL to end of array to indicate end of array. */
00274         diffargv[diffargc++] = NULL;
00275 
00276         /* Subtract column divider and divide by two. */
00277         width = (wflag - 3) / 2;
00278         /* Make sure line_width can fit in size_t. */
00279         if (width > (SIZE_T_MAX - 3) / 2)
00280                 errx(2, "width is too large: %zu", width);
00281         line_width = width * 2 + 3;
00282 
00283         if (pipe(fd))
00284                 err(2, "pipe");
00285 
00286         switch(pid = fork()) {
00287         case 0:
00288                 /* child */
00289                 /* We don't read from the pipe. */
00290                 close(fd[0]);
00291                 if (dup2(fd[1], STDOUT_FILENO) == -1)
00292                         err(2, "child could not duplicate descriptor");
00293                 /* Free unused descriptor. */
00294                 close(fd[1]);
00295 
00296                 execvp(diffprog, diffargv);
00297                 err(2, "could not execute diff: %s", diffprog);
00298         case -1:
00299                 err(2, "could not fork");
00300         }
00301 
00302         /* parent */
00303         /* We don't write to the pipe. */
00304         close(fd[1]);
00305 
00306         /* Open pipe to diff command. */
00307         if ((diffpipe = fdopen(fd[0], "r")) == NULL)
00308                 err(2, "could not open diff pipe");
00309         if ((file1 = fopen(filename1, "r")) == NULL)
00310                 err(2, "could not open %s", filename1);
00311         if ((file2 = fopen(filename2, "r")) == NULL)
00312                 err(2, "could not open %s", filename2);
00313 
00314         /* Line numbers start at one. */
00315         file1ln = file2ln = 1;
00316 
00317         /* Read and parse diff output. */
00318         while (parsecmd(diffpipe, file1, file2) != EOF)
00319                 ;
00320         fclose(diffpipe);
00321 
00322         /* Wait for diff to exit. */
00323         if (waitpid(pid, &status, 0) == -1 || !WIFEXITED(status) ||
00324             WEXITSTATUS(status) >= 2)
00325                 err(2, "diff exited abnormally");
00326 
00327         /* Delete and free unneeded temporary files. */
00328         if (tmp1)
00329                 if (unlink(tmp1))
00330                         warn("error deleting %s", tmp1);
00331         if (tmp2)
00332                 if (unlink(tmp2))
00333                         warn("error deleting %s", tmp2);
00334         free(tmp1);
00335         free(tmp2);
00336         filename1 = filename2 = tmp1 = tmp2 = NULL;
00337 
00338         /* No more diffs, so print common lines. */
00339         if (lflag)
00340                 while ((s1 = xfgets(file1)))
00341                         enqueue(s1, ' ', NULL);
00342         else
00343                 for (;;) {
00344                         s1 = xfgets(file1);
00345                         s2 = xfgets(file2);
00346                         if (s1 || s2)
00347                                 enqueue(s1, ' ', s2);
00348                         else
00349                                 break;
00350                 }
00351         fclose(file1);
00352         fclose(file2);
00353         /* Process unmodified lines. */
00354         processq();
00355 
00356         /* Return diff exit status. */
00357         return (WEXITSTATUS(status));
00358 }
00359 
00360 /*
00361  * Prints an individual column (left or right), taking into account
00362  * that tabs are variable-width.  Takes a string, the current column
00363  * the cursor is on the screen, and the maximum value of the column.
00364  * The column value is updated as we go along.
00365  */
00366 static void
00367 printcol(const char *s, size_t *col, const size_t col_max)
00368 {
00369 
00370         for (; *s && *col < col_max; ++s) {
00371                 size_t new_col;
00372 
00373                 switch (*s) {
00374                 case '\t':
00375                         /*
00376                          * If rounding to next multiple of eight causes
00377                          * an integer overflow, just return.
00378                          */
00379                         if (*col > SIZE_T_MAX - 8)
00380                                 return;
00381 
00382                         /* Round to next multiple of eight. */
00383                         new_col = (*col / 8 + 1) * 8;
00384 
00385                         /*
00386                          * If printing the tab goes past the column
00387                          * width, don't print it and just quit.
00388                          */
00389                         if (new_col > col_max)
00390                                 return;
00391                         *col = new_col;
00392                         break;
00393 
00394                 default:
00395                         ++(*col);
00396                 }
00397 
00398                 putchar(*s);
00399         }
00400 }
00401 
00402 /*
00403  * Prompts user to either choose between two strings or edit one, both,
00404  * or neither.
00405  */
00406 static void
00407 prompt(const char *s1, const char *s2)
00408 {
00409         char *cmd;
00410 
00411         /* Print command prompt. */
00412         putchar('%');
00413 
00414         /* Get user input. */
00415         for (; (cmd = xfgets(stdin)); free(cmd)) {
00416                 const char *p;
00417 
00418                 /* Skip leading whitespace. */
00419                 for (p = cmd; isspace(*p); ++p)
00420                         ;
00421 
00422                 switch (*p) {
00423                 case 'e':
00424                         /* Skip `e'. */
00425                         ++p;
00426 
00427                         if (eparse(p, s1, s2) == -1)
00428                                 goto USAGE;
00429                         break;
00430 
00431                 case 'l':
00432                 case '1':
00433                         /* Choose left column as-is. */
00434                         if (s1 != NULL)
00435                                 fprintf(outfile, "%s\n", s1);
00436 
00437                         /* End of command parsing. */
00438                         break;
00439 
00440                 case 'q':
00441                         goto QUIT;
00442 
00443                 case 'r':
00444                 case '2':
00445                         /* Choose right column as-is. */
00446                         if (s2 != NULL)
00447                                 fprintf(outfile, "%s\n", s2);
00448 
00449                         /* End of command parsing. */
00450                         break;
00451 
00452                 case 's':
00453                         sflag = 1;
00454                         goto PROMPT;
00455 
00456                 case 'v':
00457                         sflag = 0;
00458                         /* FALLTHROUGH */
00459 
00460                 default:
00461                         /* Interactive usage help. */
00462 USAGE:
00463                         int_usage();
00464 PROMPT:
00465                         putchar('%');
00466 
00467                         /* Prompt user again. */
00468                         continue;
00469                 }
00470 
00471                 free(cmd);
00472                 return;
00473         }
00474 
00475         /*
00476          * If there was no error, we received an EOF from stdin, so we
00477          * should quit.
00478          */
00479 QUIT:
00480         fclose(outfile);
00481         exit(0);
00482 }
00483 
00484 /*
00485  * Takes two strings, separated by a column divider.  NULL strings are
00486  * treated as empty columns.  If the divider is the ` ' character, the
00487  * second column is not printed (-l flag).  In this case, the second
00488  * string must be NULL.  When the second column is NULL, the divider
00489  * does not print the trailing space following the divider character.
00490  *
00491  * Takes into account that tabs can take multiple columns.
00492  */
00493 static void
00494 println(const char *s1, const char div, const char *s2)
00495 {
00496         size_t col;
00497 
00498         /* Print first column.  Skips if s1 == NULL. */
00499         col = 0;
00500         if (s1) {
00501                 /* Skip angle bracket and space. */
00502                 printcol(s1, &col, width);
00503 
00504         }
00505 
00506         /* Only print left column. */
00507         if (div == ' ' && !s2) {
00508                 putchar('\n');
00509                 return;
00510         }
00511 
00512         /* Otherwise, we pad this column up to width. */
00513         for (; col < width; ++col)
00514                 putchar(' ');
00515 
00516         /*
00517          * Print column divider.  If there is no second column, we don't
00518          * need to add the space for padding.
00519          */
00520         if (!s2) {
00521                 printf(" %c\n", div);
00522                 return;
00523         }
00524         printf(" %c ", div);
00525         col += 3;
00526 
00527         /* Skip angle bracket and space. */
00528         printcol(s2, &col, line_width);
00529 
00530         putchar('\n');
00531 }
00532 
00533 /*
00534  * Reads a line from file and returns as a string.  If EOF is reached,
00535  * NULL is returned.  The returned string must be freed afterwards.
00536  */
00537 static char *
00538 xfgets(FILE *file)
00539 {
00540         const char delim[3] = {'\0', '\0', '\0'};
00541         char *s;
00542 
00543         /* XXX - Is this necessary? */
00544         clearerr(file);
00545 
00546         if (!(s = fparseln(file, NULL, NULL, delim, 0)) &&
00547             ferror(file))
00548                 err(2, "error reading file");
00549 
00550         if (!s) {
00551                 return (NULL);
00552         }
00553 
00554         return (s);
00555 }
00556 
00557 /*
00558  * Parse ed commands from diffpipe and print lines from file1 (lines
00559  * to change or delete) or file2 (lines to add or change).
00560  * Returns EOF or 0.
00561  */
00562 static int
00563 parsecmd(FILE *diffpipe, FILE *file1, FILE *file2)
00564 {
00565         size_t file1start, file1end, file2start, file2end, n;
00566         /* ed command line and pointer to characters in line */
00567         char *line, *p, *q;
00568         const char *errstr;
00569         char c, cmd;
00570 
00571         /* Read ed command. */
00572         if (!(line = xfgets(diffpipe)))
00573                 return (EOF);
00574 
00575         p = line;
00576         /* Go to character after line number. */
00577         while (isdigit(*p))
00578                 ++p;
00579         c = *p;
00580         *p++ = 0;
00581         file1start = strtonum(line, 0, INT_MAX, &errstr);
00582         if (errstr)
00583                 errx(2, "file1 start is %s: %s", errstr, line);
00584 
00585         /* A range is specified for file1. */
00586         if (c == ',') {
00587 
00588                 q = p;
00589                 /* Go to character after file2end. */
00590                 while (isdigit(*p))
00591                         ++p;
00592                 c = *p;
00593                 *p++ = 0;
00594                 file1end = strtonum(q, 0, INT_MAX, &errstr);
00595                 if (errstr)
00596                         errx(2, "file1 end is %s: %s", errstr, line);
00597                 if (file1start > file1end)
00598                         errx(2, "invalid line range in file1: %s", line);
00599 
00600         } else
00601                 file1end = file1start;
00602 
00603         cmd = c;
00604         /* Check that cmd is valid. */
00605         if (!(cmd == 'a' || cmd == 'c' || cmd == 'd'))
00606                 errx(2, "ed command not recognized: %c: %s", cmd, line);
00607 
00608         q = p;
00609         /* Go to character after line number. */
00610         while (isdigit(*p))
00611                 ++p;
00612         c = *p;
00613         *p++ = 0;
00614         file2start = strtonum(q, 0, INT_MAX, &errstr);
00615         if (errstr)
00616                 errx(2, "file2 start is %s: %s", errstr, line);
00617 
00618         /*
00619          * There should either be a comma signifying a second line
00620          * number or the line should just end here.
00621          */
00622         if (c != ',' && c != '\0')
00623                 errx(2, "invalid line range in file2: %c: %s", c, line);
00624 
00625         if (c == ',') {
00626 
00627                 file2end = strtonum(p, 0, INT_MAX, &errstr);
00628                 if (errstr)
00629                         errx(2, "file2 end is %s: %s", errstr, line);
00630                 if (file2start >= file2end)
00631                         errx(2, "invalid line range in file2: %s", line);
00632         } else
00633                 file2end = file2start;
00634 
00635         /* Appends happen _after_ stated line. */
00636         if (cmd == 'a') {
00637                 if (file1start != file1end)
00638                         errx(2, "append cannot have a file1 range: %s",
00639                             line);
00640                 if (file1start == SIZE_T_MAX)
00641                         errx(2, "file1 line range too high: %s", line);
00642                 file1start = ++file1end;
00643         }
00644         /*
00645          * I'm not sure what the deal is with the line numbers for
00646          * deletes, though.
00647          */
00648         else if (cmd == 'd') {
00649                 if (file2start != file2end)
00650                         errx(2, "delete cannot have a file2 range: %s",
00651                             line);
00652                 if (file2start == SIZE_T_MAX)
00653                         errx(2, "file2 line range too high: %s", line);
00654                 file2start = ++file2end;
00655         }
00656 
00657         /*
00658          * Continue reading file1 and file2 until we reach line numbers
00659          * specified by diff.  Should only happen with -I flag.
00660          */
00661         for (; file1ln < file1start && file2ln < file2start;
00662             ++file1ln, ++file2ln) {
00663                 char *s1, *s2;
00664 
00665                 if (!(s1 = xfgets(file1)))
00666                         errx(2, "file1 shorter than expected");
00667                 if (!(s2 = xfgets(file2)))
00668                         errx(2, "file2 shorter than expected");
00669 
00670                 /* If the -l flag was specified, print only left column. */
00671                 if (lflag) {
00672                         free(s2);
00673                         /*
00674                          * XXX - If -l and -I are both specified, all
00675                          * unchanged or ignored lines are shown with a
00676                          * `(' divider.  This matches GNU sdiff, but I
00677                          * believe it is a bug.  Just check out:
00678                          * gsdiff -l -I '^$' samefile samefile.
00679                          */
00680                         if (Iflag)
00681                                 enqueue(s1, '(', NULL);
00682                         else
00683                                 enqueue(s1, ' ', NULL);
00684                 } else
00685                         enqueue(s1, ' ', s2);
00686         }
00687         /* Ignore deleted lines. */
00688         for (; file1ln < file1start; ++file1ln) {
00689                 char *s;
00690 
00691                 if (!(s = xfgets(file1)))
00692                         errx(2, "file1 shorter than expected");
00693 
00694                 enqueue(s, '(', NULL);
00695         }
00696         /* Ignore added lines. */
00697         for (; file2ln < file2start; ++file2ln) {
00698                 char *s;
00699 
00700                 if (!(s = xfgets(file2)))
00701                         errx(2, "file2 shorter than expected");
00702 
00703                 /* If -l flag was given, don't print right column. */
00704                 if (lflag)
00705                         free(s);
00706                 else
00707                         enqueue(NULL, ')', s);
00708         }
00709 
00710         /* Process unmodified or skipped lines. */
00711         processq();
00712 
00713         switch (cmd) {
00714         case 'a':
00715                 printa(file2, file2end);
00716                 n = file2end - file2start + 1;
00717                 break;
00718 
00719         case 'c':
00720                 printc(file1, file1end, file2, file2end);
00721                 n = file1end - file1start + 1 + 1 + file2end - file2start + 1;
00722                 break;
00723 
00724         case 'd':
00725                 printd(file1, file1end);
00726                 n = file1end - file1start + 1;
00727                 break;
00728 
00729         default:
00730                 errx(2, "invalid diff command: %c: %s", cmd, line);
00731         }
00732 
00733         /* Skip to next ed line. */
00734         while (n--)
00735                 if (!xfgets(diffpipe))
00736                         errx(2, "diff ended early");
00737 
00738         return (0);
00739 }
00740 
00741 /*
00742  * Queues up a diff line.
00743  */
00744 static void
00745 enqueue(char *left, char div, char *right)
00746 {
00747         struct diffline *diffp;
00748 
00749         if (!(diffp = malloc(sizeof(struct diffline))))
00750                 err(2, "enqueue");
00751         diffp->left = left;
00752         diffp->div = div;
00753         diffp->right = right;
00754         SIMPLEQ_INSERT_TAIL(&diffhead, diffp, diffentries);
00755 }
00756 
00757 /*
00758  * Free a diffline structure and its elements.
00759  */
00760 static void
00761 freediff(struct diffline *diffp)
00762 {
00763         free(diffp->left);
00764         free(diffp->right);
00765         free(diffp);
00766 }
00767 
00768 /*
00769  * Append second string into first.  Repeated appends to the same string
00770  * are cached, making this an O(n) function, where n = strlen(append).
00771  */
00772 static void
00773 astrcat(char **s, const char *append)
00774 {
00775         /* Length of string in previous run. */
00776         static size_t offset = 0;
00777         size_t newsiz;
00778         /*
00779          * String from previous run.  Compared to *s to see if we are
00780          * dealing with the same string.  If so, we can use offset.
00781          */
00782         static const char *oldstr = NULL;
00783         char *newstr;
00784 
00785 
00786         /*
00787          * First string is NULL, so just copy append.
00788          */
00789         if (!*s) {
00790                 if (!(*s = strdup(append)))
00791                         err(2, "astrcat");
00792 
00793                 /* Keep track of string. */
00794                 offset = strlen(*s);
00795                 oldstr = *s;
00796 
00797                 return;
00798         }
00799 
00800         /*
00801          * *s is a string so concatenate.
00802          */
00803 
00804         /* Did we process the same string in the last run? */
00805         /*
00806          * If this is a different string from the one we just processed
00807          * cache new string.
00808          */
00809         if (oldstr != *s) {
00810                 offset = strlen(*s);
00811                 oldstr = *s;
00812         }
00813 
00814         /* Size = strlen(*s) + \n + strlen(append) + '\0'. */
00815         newsiz = offset + 1 + strlen(append) + 1;
00816 
00817         /* Resize *s to fit new string. */
00818         newstr = realloc(*s, newsiz);
00819         if (newstr == NULL)
00820                 err(2, "astrcat");
00821         *s = newstr;
00822 
00823         /* *s + offset should be end of string. */
00824         /* Concatenate. */
00825         strlcpy(*s + offset, "\n", newsiz - offset);
00826         strlcat(*s + offset, append, newsiz - offset);
00827 
00828         /* New string length should be exactly newsiz - 1 characters. */
00829         /* Store generated string's values. */
00830         offset = newsiz - 1;
00831         oldstr = *s;
00832 }
00833 
00834 /*
00835  * Process diff set queue, printing, prompting, and saving each diff
00836  * line stored in queue.
00837  */
00838 static void
00839 processq(void)
00840 {
00841         struct diffline *diffp;
00842         char divc, *left, *right;
00843 
00844         /* Don't process empty queue. */
00845         if (SIMPLEQ_EMPTY(&diffhead))
00846                 return;
00847 
00848         /* Remember the divider. */
00849         divc = SIMPLEQ_FIRST(&diffhead)->div;
00850 
00851         left = NULL;
00852         right = NULL;
00853         /*
00854          * Go through set of diffs, concatenating each line in left or
00855          * right column into two long strings, `left' and `right'.
00856          */
00857         SIMPLEQ_FOREACH(diffp, &diffhead, diffentries) {
00858                 /*
00859                  * Print changed lines if -s was given,
00860                  * print all lines if -s was not given.
00861                  */
00862                 if (!sflag || diffp->div == '|' || diffp->div == '<' ||
00863                     diffp->div == '>')
00864                         println(diffp->left, diffp->div, diffp->right);
00865 
00866                 /* Append new lines to diff set. */
00867                 if (diffp->left)
00868                         astrcat(&left, diffp->left);
00869                 if (diffp->right)
00870                         astrcat(&right, diffp->right);
00871         }
00872 
00873         /* Empty queue and free each diff line and its elements. */
00874         while (!SIMPLEQ_EMPTY(&diffhead)) {
00875                 diffp = SIMPLEQ_FIRST(&diffhead);
00876                 SIMPLEQ_REMOVE_HEAD(&diffhead, diffentries);
00877                 freediff(diffp);
00878         }
00879 
00880         /* Write to outfile, prompting user if lines are different. */
00881         if (outfile)
00882                 switch (divc) {
00883                 case ' ': case '(': case ')':
00884                         fprintf(outfile, "%s\n", left);
00885                         break;
00886                 case '|': case '<': case '>':
00887                         prompt(left, right);
00888                         break;
00889                 default:
00890                         errx(2, "invalid divider: %c", divc);
00891                 }
00892 
00893         /* Free left and right. */
00894         free(left);
00895         free(right);
00896 }
00897 
00898 /*
00899  * Print lines following an (a)ppend command.
00900  */
00901 static void
00902 printa(FILE *file, size_t line2)
00903 {
00904         char *line;
00905 
00906         for (; file2ln <= line2; ++file2ln) {
00907                 if (!(line = xfgets(file)))
00908                         errx(2, "append ended early");
00909                 enqueue(NULL, '>', line);
00910         }
00911 
00912         processq();
00913 }
00914 
00915 /*
00916  * Print lines following a (c)hange command, from file1ln to file1end
00917  * and from file2ln to file2end.
00918  */
00919 static void
00920 printc(FILE *file1, size_t file1end, FILE *file2, size_t file2end)
00921 {
00922         struct fileline {
00923                 SIMPLEQ_ENTRY(fileline)  fileentries;
00924                 char                    *line;
00925         };
00926         SIMPLEQ_HEAD(, fileline) delqhead = SIMPLEQ_HEAD_INITIALIZER(delqhead);
00927 
00928         /* Read lines to be deleted. */
00929         for (; file1ln <= file1end; ++file1ln) {
00930                 struct fileline *linep;
00931                 char *line1;
00932 
00933                 /* Read lines from both. */
00934                 if (!(line1 = xfgets(file1)))
00935                         errx(2, "error reading file1 in delete in change");
00936 
00937                 /* Add to delete queue. */
00938                 if (!(linep = malloc(sizeof(struct fileline))))
00939                         err(2, "printc");
00940                 linep->line = line1;
00941                 SIMPLEQ_INSERT_TAIL(&delqhead, linep, fileentries);
00942         }
00943 
00944         /* Process changed lines.. */
00945         for (; !SIMPLEQ_EMPTY(&delqhead) && file2ln <= file2end;
00946             ++file2ln) {
00947                 struct fileline *del;
00948                 char *add;
00949 
00950                 /* Get add line. */
00951                 if (!(add = xfgets(file2)))
00952                         errx(2, "error reading add in change");
00953 
00954                 del = SIMPLEQ_FIRST(&delqhead);
00955                 enqueue(del->line, '|', add);
00956                 SIMPLEQ_REMOVE_HEAD(&delqhead, fileentries);
00957                 /*
00958                  * Free fileline structure but not its elements since
00959                  * they are queued up.
00960                  */
00961                 free(del);
00962         }
00963         processq();
00964 
00965         /* Process remaining lines to add. */
00966         for (; file2ln <= file2end; ++file2ln) {
00967                 char *add;
00968 
00969                 /* Get add line. */
00970                 if (!(add = xfgets(file2)))
00971                         errx(2, "error reading add in change");
00972 
00973                 enqueue(NULL, '>', add);
00974         }
00975         processq();
00976 
00977         /* Process remaining lines to delete. */
00978         while (!SIMPLEQ_EMPTY(&delqhead)) {
00979                 struct fileline *filep;
00980 
00981                 filep = SIMPLEQ_FIRST(&delqhead);
00982                 enqueue(filep->line, '<', NULL);
00983                 SIMPLEQ_REMOVE_HEAD(&delqhead, fileentries);
00984                 free(filep);
00985         }
00986         processq();
00987 }
00988 
00989 /*
00990  * Print deleted lines from file, from file1ln to file1end.
00991  */
00992 static void
00993 printd(FILE *file1, size_t file1end)
00994 {
00995         char *line1;
00996 
00997         /* Print out lines file1ln to line2. */
00998         for (; file1ln <= file1end; ++file1ln) {
00999                 /* XXX - Why can't this handle stdin? */
01000                 if (!(line1 = xfgets(file1)))
01001                         errx(2, "file1 ended early in delete");
01002                 enqueue(line1, '<', NULL);
01003         }
01004         processq();
01005 }
01006 
01007 /*
01008  * Interactive mode usage.
01009  */
01010 static void
01011 int_usage(void)
01012 {
01013         puts("e:\tedit blank diff\n"
01014             "eb:\tedit both diffs concatenated\n"
01015             "el:\tedit left diff\n"
01016             "er:\tedit right diff\n"
01017             "l | 1:\tchoose left diff\n"
01018             "r | 2:\tchoose right diff\n"
01019             "s:\tsilent mode--don't print identical lines\n"
01020             "v:\tverbose mode--print identical lines\n"
01021             "q:\tquit");
01022 }
01023 
01024 static void
01025 usage(void)
01026 {
01027         extern char *__progname;
01028 
01029         fprintf(stderr,
01030             "usage: %s [-abdilstW] [-I regexp] [-o outfile] [-w width] file1 file2\n",
01031             __progname);
01032         exit(2);
01033 }
